alert.note: Alert for Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 13 at 2:22PM CDT until April 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning in Central and Parts of East Central Wisconsin through Early Evening... ...Fire Weather Watch in Central Wisconsin on Friday... .Record or near record warm temperatures, combined with winds gusting to 25 mph and relative humidity falling to 20 to 25 percent, will produce critical fire weather conditions across portions of central and east central Wisconsin through early evening. Similar conditions are anticipated over central Wisconsin on Friday, so a Fire Weather Watch has been issued there. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS IN CENTRAL AND PARTS OF EAST CENTRAL WISCONSIN... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS IN CENTRAL WISCONSIN... The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a Fire Weather Watch for critical fire weather conditions, which is in effect from late Friday morning through Friday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Wood, Portage, Waupaca and Waushara. * TIMING...For the Red Flag Warning, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For the Fire Weather Watch, from late Friday morning through Friday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 12 to 17 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 to 22 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower to middle 80s. * IMPACTS...Fires will start easily and spread quickly in these conditions, so outdoor burning should not be attempted. Visit the Wisconsin DNR website to view current burning restrictions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning is issued when critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or are imminent. A combination of strong winds, very low relative humidity, warm temperatures and exceptionally dry fuels will create dangerous wildland fire conditions. Persons are urged to be careful with any activities that could potentially lead to a wildland fire. Campfires, outdoor grills, smoking materials, chain saws, and all- terrain vehicles all have the potential to throw a spark and ignite a dangerous and destructive fire. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this red flag warning.
